intro: Mohrodendron parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered mohrodendron, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate or elliptic in shape. Its small, fragrant flowers are typically white or pale pink and are borne in clusters. The botanical characteristics of M. parviflorum make it an interesting subject for horticultural study and conservation efforts.
